intro: Teucrium visitationis, commonly known as the holy thyme or the plant of visitation, is a flowering plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its aromatic, square stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often growing in dry, rocky soils. Teucrium visitationis is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in traditional herbal remedies.
